original: Ehrenborg, Erik Michael Carä, häradshövding, fd. revisionssekreterare, krigsdomare, Jönköping, f. 26/7/84 i Stoby, Krist. 1., av major Casper E. o. Hilda Santesson. G. 22 m. Birgitta Forssbeck. Barn: Eva f. 23, Casper 26, jur. stud., Jöns 32, Brita 34. — Jur. kand. i Lund 08. Tf. hovr :fiskal 11, e. o. assessor 12, ord. dito .15, tf. rev:-sekr. s. å., hovr :råd i hovr. över Skåne o. Blek. 20, led. av jordkomm. 20-23, tf. exp:chef 21, 22 o. 24, rev:sekr. 21, här:hövd. i Tveta, Vista o. Mo doms. iS’ed. 28, krigisdiom. v. Smàli. arméiairit:-reg., sederm. Smål. art:reg., sed. 30. Ordf. i stadsplanelagskomm. 25-28. KN02kl.
translated: Ehrenborg, Erik Michael Carä, district judge, former audit secretary, war judge, Jönköping, born on July 26, 1884 in Stoby, Kristianstad, son of Major Casper E. and Hilda Santesson. Married to Birgitta Forssbeck in 1922. Children: Eva, born in 1923, Casper, born in 1926 and studying law, Jöns, born in 1932, Brita, born in 1934. Earned a law degree from Lund University in 1908. Temporarily worked as a court prosecutor in 1911, appointed as an assessor in 1912 and as a judge in 1915. Temporarily worked as an audit secretary in the same year. Appointed as a council in the court of appeal for Skåne and Blekinge in 1920, served as a member of the land committee from 1920 to 1923, and temporarily worked as the head of the audit department in 1921, 1922 and 1924. Became an audit secretary in the same year. Appointed as a district judge in Tveta, Vista and Mo in 1928, and as a war judge for the Smallland Army Air Regiment, later the Smallland Artillery Regiment, in 1930. Served as chairman of the city planning committee from 1925 to 1928. Received the order of the North Star, Knight 2nd class.

memberOf.name: Court of Appeal for Skåne and Blekinge
